disk_read_bytes_description_header: Average number of bytes read over a given period.
disk_read_bytes_description_content: The number of bytes read from all storage volumes linked to the instance. This metric helps estimate how much data the application reads from the disk storage, enabling I/O performance analysis. The reported value is the total number of bytes read during the specified timeframe. With basic monitoring (5 minutes), divide this value by 300 to get the bytes per second.
disk_read_iops_description_header: Average number of completed read operations over a given period.
disk_write_bytes_description_header: Average number of bytes written over a given period.
disk_write_iops_description_header: Average number of completed write operations over a given period.
cpu_utilization_description_header: Percentage of CPU resources used by the instance over a given period, allowing identification of load trends and potential bottlenecks.
network_description_header: Displays the incoming network traffic rate of the instance in bytes per second, useful for monitoring incoming data flow and detecting spikes or anomalies.
network_out_description_header: Displays the outgoing network traffic rate of the instance in bytes per second, allowing tracking of data emission and identification of unusual or large transfers.
network_packets_in_description_header: Displays the number of incoming network packets per second for the instance, useful for analyzing traffic intensity and packet-level activity.
network_packets_out_description_header: Displays the number of outgoing network packets per second for the instance, allowing monitoring of outgoing traffic trends and detection of abnormal packet rates.
memory_utilization_description_header: Displays the percentage of memory used by the instance over time, allowing identification of memory pressure, leaks, or capacity limits.
